docblock.description: Database and template file access for MLA needs.
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) Data provides database and template file access for MLA needs.
docblock.long-description: The _template functions are inspired by the book "WordPress 3 Plugin Development Essentials." Templates separate HTML markup from PHP code for easier maintenance and localization.

docblock.description: Initialization function, similar to __construct()
Load an HTML template from a file
docblock.long-description: Loads a template to a string or a multi-part template to an array. Multi-part templates are divided by comments of the form , where "key" becomes the key part of the array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Complete path and name of the template file

tag.name: return
tag.description: For files that do not contain template divider comments array For files containing template divider comments false If file does not exist NULL If file could not be loaded

docblock.description: Expand a template, replacing place holders with their values.
docblock.long-description: A simple parsing function for basic templating.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array containing keys and values e.g. array('key' => 'value');

tag.name: return
tag.description: Placeholders corresponding to the keys of the hash will be replaced with their values.

docblock.description: Sanitize and expand query arguments from request variables.
docblock.long-description: Prepare the arguments for WP_Query. Modeled after wp_edit_attachments_query in wp-admin/post.php NOTE: The caller must remove the 'posts_where' filter, if required.

tag.name: param
tag.description: query parameters from web page, usually found in $_REQUEST

docblock.description: Retrieve attachment objects for list table display.
docblock.long-description: Supports prepare_items in class-mla-list-table.php Modeled after wp_edit_attachments_query in wp-admin/post.php

tag.name: param
tag.description: query parameters from web page, usually found in $_REQUEST

tag.name: param
tag.description: number of rows to skip over to reach desired page

tag.name: param
tag.description: number of rows on each page

tag.name: return
tag.description: attachment objects (posts) including parent data, meta data and references

docblock.description: Adds a WHERE clause for detached items
docblock.long-description: Modeled after _edit_attachments_query_helper in wp-admin/post.php Defined as public so callers can remove it after the query

docblock.description: Retrieve an Attachment array given a $post_id.
docblock.long-description: The (associative) array will contain every field that can be found in the posts and postmeta tables, and all references to the attachment.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of the attachment post.

docblock.description: Find Featured Image and inserted image/link references to an attachment.
docblock.long-description: Searches all post and page content to see if the attachment is used as a Featured Image or inserted in the post as an image or link.

tag.name: param
tag.description: post ID of attachment's parent, if any

docblock.description: Returns information about an attachment's parent, if found.

tag.name: param
tag.description: post ID of attachment's parent, if any

tag.name: return
tag.description: Parent information; post_date, post_title and post_type

docblock.description: Fetch and filter meta data for an attachment.
docblock.long-description: Returns a filtered array of a post's meta data. Internal values beginning with '' are stripped out or converted to an 'mla' equivalent. Array data is replaced with a string containing the first array element.

docblock.description: Media Library Assistant extended List Table class
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) List Table extends the core WP_List_Table class
Records assignment of row-level actions to a table row
docblock.long-description: Set to the current Post-ID when row-level actions are output for the row.

docblock.description: Currently hidden columns
docblock.long-description: Records hidden columns so row-level actions are not assigned to them.

property.name: $default_columns
property.default: array('cb' => '<input type="checkbox" />', 'icon' => '', 'ID_parent' => 'ID/Parent', 'title_name' => 'Title/Name', 'post_title' => 'Title', 'post_name' => 'Name', 'parent' => 'Parent ID', 'featured' => 'Featured in', 'inserted' => 'Inserted in', 'alt_text' => 'ALT Text', 'caption' => 'Caption', 'description' => 'Description', 'base_file' => 'Base File', 'date' => 'Date', 'author' => 'Author', 'attached_to' => 'Attached to', 'categories' => 'Att. Categories', 'tags' => 'Att. Tags')

docblock.description: Table column definitions
docblock.long-description:
This array defines table columns and titles where the key is the column slug (and class) and the value is the column's title text. If you need a checkbox for bulk actions, use the special slug "cb".

The 'cb' column is treated differently than the rest. If including a checkbox column in your table you must create a column_cb() method. If you don't need bulk actions or checkboxes, simply leave the 'cb' entry out of your array.

docblock.description: Default values for hdden columns
docblock.long-description:
This array is used when the user-level option is not set, i.e., the user has not altered the selection of hidden columns.

The value on the right-hand side must match the column slug, e.g., array(0 => 'ID_parent, 1 => 'title_name').

property.name: $default_sortable_columns
property.default: array('ID_parent' => array('ID', false), 'title_name' => array('title_name', false), 'post_title' => array('post_title', false), 'post_name' => array('name', false), 'parent' => array('parent', false), 'caption' => array('post_excerpt', false), 'description' => array('post_content', false), 'date' => array('post_date', false), 'author' => array('post_author', false), 'attached_to' => array('post_parent', false))

docblock.description: Sortable column definitions
docblock.long-description:
This array defines the table columns that can be sorted. The array key is the column slug that needs to be sortable, and the value is database column to sort by. Often, the key and value will be the same, but this is not always the case (as the value is a column name from the database, not the list table).

The array value also contains a boolean which is 'true' if the data is currently sorted by that column. This is computed each time the table is displayed.

docblock.description: Access the default list of hidden columns
Handler for filter 'get_user_option_managemedia_page_mla-menucolumnshidden'
docblock.long-description: Required because the screen.php get_hidden_columns function only uses the get_user_option result. Set when the file is loaded because the object is not created in time for the call from screen.php.

tag.name: param
tag.description: current list of hidden columns, if any

docblock.description: Handler for filter 'manage_media_page_mla-menu_columns'
docblock.long-description: This required filter dictates the table's columns and titles. Set when the file is loaded because the list_table object isn't created in time to affect the "screen options" setup.

docblock.description: Initializes some properties from $_REQUEST vairables, then calls the parent constructor to set some default configs.
Called when the parent class can't find a method specifically built for a given column.
docblock.long-description: All our columns should have a specific method, so this function returns a troubleshooting message.

tag.description: A singular item (one full row's worth of data)

tag.description: The name/slug of the column to be processed

tag.name: return
tag.description: Text or HTML to be placed inside the column

docblock.description: This method dictates the table's columns and titles.
Returns the list of currently hidden columns from a user option or from default values if the option is not set
Returns an array where the key is the column that needs to be sortable and the value is db column to sort by.
docblock.long-description: Also notes the current sort column, if set.

docblock.description: Returns an associative array listing all the views that can be used with this table.
docblock.long-description: These are listed across the top of the page and managed by WordPress.

docblock.description: Get an associative array ( option_name => option_title ) with the list of bulk actions available on this table.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Contains all the bulk actions: 'slugs'=>'Visible Titles'

docblock.description: Extra controls to be displayed between bulk actions and pagination.
docblock.long-description: Modeled after class-wp-posts-list-table.php in wp-admin/includes

tag.name: param
tag.description: 'top' or 'bottom', i.e., above or below the table rows

tag.name: return
tag.description: Contains all the bulk actions: 'slugs'=>'Visible Titles'

docblock.description: Prepares the list of items for displaying.
docblock.long-description: This is where you prepare your data for display. This method will usually be used to query the database, sort and filter the data, and generally get it ready to be displayed. At a minimum, we should set $this->items and $this->set_pagination_args().

docblock.description: Get possible mime types for view preparation.
docblock.long-description: Modeled after get_post_mime_types in wp-admin/includes/post.php, with additional entries.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Mime type names and HTML markup for views

docblock.description: Get mime types with one or more attachments for view preparation.
docblock.long-description: Modeled after get_available_post_mime_types in wp-admin/includes/post.php, with additional entries.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Number of posts for each mime type

docblock.description: Get the total number of attachment posts
Top-level functions for the Media Library Assistant
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) provides several enhancements to the handling of images and files held in the WordPress Media Library.
Display name for this plugin
Current version number
Minimum version of PHP required for this plugin
Minimum version of WordPress required for this plugin
Slug for registering and enqueueing plugin style sheet
Slug for localizing and enqueueing plugin JavaScript
Slug for adding plugin submenu
Action name; uniquely identifies the nonce
mla_admin_action value for permanently deleting a single item
mla_admin_action value for displaying a single item
mla_admin_action value for updating a single item
mla_admin_action value for restoring a single item from the trash
mla_admin_action value for moving a single item to the trash
Holds screen ids to match help text to corresponding screen
Initialization function, similar to __construct()
Load the plugin's Style Sheet and Javascript files

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the page being loaded

docblock.description: Add the submenu pages
docblock.long-description: Add a submenu page in the "Media" section, add submenu page(s) for attachment taxonomies, add filter to clean up taxonomy submenu labels add settings page in the "Settings" section, add settings link in the Plugins section entry for MLA.

docblock.description: Add the "XX Entries per page" filter to the Screen Options tab
Only show screen options on the table-list screen

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to display "Screen Options", false to suppress them

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the page being loaded

tag.name: return
tag.description: True to display "Screen Options", false to suppress them

docblock.description: Save the "Entries per page" option set by this user

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the option being changed

tag.name: return
tag.description: New value if this is our option, otherwise nothing

docblock.description: Redirect to the Edit Tags/Categories page
docblock.long-description: The custom taxonomy add/edit submenu entries go to "upload.php" by default. This filter is the only way to redirect them to the correct WordPress page.

docblock.description: Add contextual help tabs to all the MLA pages
Cleanup menus for Edit Tags/Categories page
docblock.long-description: The submenu entries for custom taxonomies under the "Media" menu are not set up correctly by WordPress, so this function cleans them up, redirecting the request to the right WordPress page for editing/adding taxonomy terms.

docblock.description: Render the "Assistant" subpage in the Media section, using the list_table package
Get the current action selected from the bulk actions dropdown.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The action name or False if no action was selected

docblock.description: Delete a single item permanently.
Display a single item sub page; prepare the form to change the meta data for a single attachment.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The WordPress Post ID of the attachment item

docblock.description: Update a single item; change the meta data for a single attachment.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of the attachment to be updated

docblock.description: Restore a single item from the Trash
Move a single item to Trash
Manages the plugin option settings and provides the settings page to edit them
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) Settings manages the plugin option settings and provides the settings page to edit them.
Provides a unique name for the settings page.

property.name: $mla_options
property.default: array('taxonomies' => array('name' => 'Pre-defined Taxonomies', 'type' => 'header'), 'attachment_category' => array('name' => 'Attachment Categories', 'type' => 'checkbox', 'std' => 'checked', 'help' => 'Check this option to add support for Attachment Categories.'), 'attachment_tag' => array('name' => 'Attachment Tags', 'type' => 'checkbox', 'std' => 'checked', 'help' => 'Check this option to add support for Attachment Tags.'))

docblock.description: $mla_options defines the database options and admin page areas for setting/updating them.
docblock.long-description:
Each option is defined by an array with the following elements:

array key => HTML id/name attribute and option database key (OMIT MLA_OPTION_PREFIX)

name => admin page label or heading text type => 'checkbox', 'header', 'radio', 'select', 'text', 'textarea' std => default value help => help text size => text size, default 40 cols => textbox columns, default 90 rows => textbox rows, default 5 options => array of radio or select option values

docblock.description: Initialization function, similar to __construct()
Add settings page in the "Settings" section, add settings link in the Plugins section entry for MLA.
Add the "Settings" link to the MLA entry in the Plugins section

tag.name: param
tag.description: array of links for the Plugin, e.g., "Activate"

tag.name: param
tag.description: Directory and name of the plugin Index file

tag.name: return
tag.description: Updated array of links for the Plugin

docblock.description: Return the stored value or default value of a defined MLA option

tag.name: return
tag.description: Value(s) for the option or false if the option is not a defined MLA option

docblock.description: Add or update the stored value of a defined MLA option

tag.name: param
tag.description: New value for the desired option

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the value was changed or false if the update failed

docblock.description: Delete the stored value of a defined MLA option

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the option was deleted, otherwise false

Provides path information to the plugin root in file system format.
Provides path information to the plugin root in URL format.
Gives a unique prefix for plugin options; can be set in wp-config.php
Provides basic run-time tests to ensure the plugin can run in the current WordPress envrionment
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) Test provides basic run-time tests to ensure the plugin can run in the current WordPress envrionment.
Test that your PHP version is at least that of the $min_php_version

tag.name: param
tag.description: representing the minimum required version of PHP, e.g. '5.3.2'

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the plugin for messaging purposes

tag.name: return
tag.description: Exit with messaging if PHP version is too old

docblock.description: Test that your WordPress version is at least that of the $min_version

tag.description: representing the minimum required version of WordPress, e.g. '3.3.0'

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the plugin for messaging purposes

tag.description: Exit with messaging if version is too old
